content:
hi team, @Santiago Pastorino pointed me to a funny thing in the latest crater run
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/87455#issuecomment-897891685

apparently this repository of mine with some testing code ended up in the crater run
https://github.com/apiraino/warp-mobc-tokio
I have no idea how that repo ended up there :) but it should probably be removed

I was curious to understand how repositories are added to the crater run and also how can be removed
(hoping this is the right place to ask)
afaik, crater looks at every single rust repo on github with a Cargo.lock file in it.
roughly, yeah. Is there a reason to remove this particular repository?

oh I see.

Well, I thought it can be removed because that repository is nothing really interesting, will never be updated (so the code will eventually rot) and also to avoid unneeded burden to the crater run, it's just wasted CPU cycles (and perhaps AWS bill $$$)
but if removing one crate if more work than leaving it - that's fine either for me :)
there's an ignore list or something, but yeah, it's not really worth bothering with
